newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: South Korea's Kim meets Saudi oil minister.
newsitem.headline: South Korea's Kim meets Saudi oil minister.

text.p: South Korean President Kim Young-sam discussed energy cooperation with Saudi Arabia 's minister of petroleum and mineral resources on Tuesday, a statement from the president's office said.

"We ask that you pay closer attention to maintaining a steady supply as well as stable price for crude oil and liquefied petroleum gas (LPG)," the statement quoted Kim as saying to Ali bin Ibrahim Al-Naimi.
South Korea relies heavily on supplies of crude oil and LPG from Saudi Arabia.
Kim also asked Al-Naimi to help South Korean companies participate in major development projects in Saudi Arabia.
The Saudi minister visited his counterpart Lim Chang-yeul on Monday to exchange views on improving energy relations.
Saudi Arabian embassy officials in Seoul said the minister was visiting South Korea on an invitation from Ssangyong Oil Refining Co.
Al-Naimi will attend Ssangyong's completion ceremony on Wednesday for its 50,000 barrel-per-day residue fluid catalytic cracker in Onsan, southeast of Seoul, a Ssangyong spokesman said.
Saudi Aramco has a 35 percent stake in Ssangyong Oil.
